item.title: You
item.description: Stop. Take a good hard look at yourself. Undressed Unstressed Without anything festering Just…at your best. Smile. Smile at who you are now…
item.content:encoded:
Stop.

Take a good hard look at yourself.

Undressed

Unstressed

Without anything festering

Just…at your best.

Smile.

Smile at who you are now

Be proud

Of where you have come from and how

You have lived, survived

With the cards you have been dealt, understand that you can’t always thrive

But you can accept.

Because you are okay, you are beautiful in your way

Learn to accept the things that make you stay

And live another day

And say

You are you

And no-one can take that away from you

Learn to separate

Love from hate

To differentiate

Between your intuition and your mind

That gate

Between two worlds

Know that you have to trust yourself

Your intuition

Because your mind can lie

And although your mind might be happy, your soul is what matters more

So learn to close that door

Between you and the world if the world is too much

And just stop.

Stop trying to achieve

At the sacrifice of breathing.

Stop trying to always be on the move,

To constantly be doing.

Just stop and listen to you.

And it’s okay, you don’t owe them anything.

You owe yourself your love and care

Only you can make it there

Where

You want to go.

And stop caring about what others think

Stop thinking about them over yourself

And putting things up on the shelf

For them.

Stop and think of yourself.

What do you want.

In this day and age

It is so easy to take what others say

And to believe and think the same way

Without even stopping to think if that’s also

The way you want to go

And then one day

You wake up and think

Where has my soul gone away?

And they might hate you for it

They might hate what they don’t understand

But leave that hate with them

Don’t take

It with you

Don’t take

It as a guiding point for what you should do.

Just do you.

So stop.

Turn off the world and just listen to yourself.

Look in the mirror and on that shelf.

And look for you.

And ask yourself,

What do you want.

item.title: Forbidden Fruit
item.description: The following poem reflects the dedication it takes to say no to the things in life we may want in the moment but truly know deep down that…
item.content:encoded:
The following poem reflects the dedication it takes to say no to the things in life we may want in the moment but truly know deep down that it may not be what is best for us, whether that be quitting sugar or a relationship that we know has to end. When we strive to change a habit, relapses tend to be frequent. It’s important to know that it happens and that it doesn’t mean we should give up. The first step is always the hardest when it comes to changing a habit, but know that it gets easier over time.

It has become a real challenge to avoid the daily temptations of sugar, both refined or unrefined, seeing as it is hidden in everything these days. This poem is a direct tribute to all who are pursuing the Ketogenic lifestyle for the good of their health. It is dedicated to the hard work people put in to maintain good health and the ability to stick to their health goals, even if it means giving up their favourite sweets along the way .

Alright. So I cheated.

I ate a banana with nut butter.

I can’t say it was worth it

I actually feel worse and

I’ve got a headache and my face is red and flushed like–

From the sugar spike

But that might

Have been the last banana I’ll ever eat.

But there you go

Now I know

It’s the sweet sugar that causes the volcano

Of issues to erupt

Like the red butterfly flush

On my face

Like the tiny veins

Of circulatory webs filling up the space

Of my skin

And so

Ketosis is definitely the answer to my health issues.

Although

I do regret eating you, final banana,

I’m going to take the fact that I did it

As a learning experience

And I think otherwise I will only cheat when I go to a Christmas party or a work dinner.

So yeah I cheated.

But it could have been worse

Tiny packets of honey small enough to pop into a purse

Or I could have immersed

Myself in a Trojan hearse

Of those cherry chocolates

Or candy rockets

Throw in some quick before the shock hits

Or cheerios

Or oreos

Or Cleo’s

with the

Sugar filling

Sugar coating

Sugar overflowing

Sugar inside and out

Refined

Combined

Flavours bursting intertwined

But I’m too determined

As I remind

Myself of my state of mind

Declined

When the plague of the sugar blocks the blood flow to my mind

My brain

Making me insane

Sit

In the slits

And the pockets of my liver

Nestle

Constricting blood vessels

Where it will fail to deliver

Blood

And oxygen

Have my heart hammer

Like the deep bong

Of a throng

Of organ

Chords

Then quit.

But…

It was a banana though

So

At least I still got some fiber and potassium out of it.

But I guess even for fruit, sugar is sugar

So

I’ll have to stick to berries and avocados.

Limited though.

But banana…

I’m going to keep going tomorrow like you never happened.

Sorry, but you’ve had your run.

It was great while it lasted

But now I’ve got to move on.

I’m going to miss peeling your skin,

Opening you up,

Dipping your body into creamy nut butter

– almond of course, cashew has too many carbs –

Sprinkling cinnamon onto your surface,

Slicing you up and rolling you between date paste –

Wait.

I mean,

You were the only sugar for me.

Dates shrivel in comparison.

But see

Now I can’t have either of you

Even if I wanted the date too

– which I don’t –

You’re just forbidden fruit.

item.title: Cemetery Time
item.description: I was born in a house beside a cemetery. People have often asked me, hasn’t that been scary Growing up with ghosts next door, hasn’t that…
item.content:encoded:
I was born in a house beside a cemetery.

People have often asked me, hasn’t that been scary

Growing up with ghosts next door, hasn’t that ever bothered me

That I’ve lived by the divide line

Where the dead and the living meet

On the other side of the fence at the end of that street

The land strewn with graves and petals of flowers

Made bare by the wind and by the hour

That fence which holds time at bay

Being that on the other side lays

A past that none of us on this side will ever face.

They say

Aren’t you afraid

That when the zombies rise up from their graves

I’ll be the first one they taste?

But I’ve never thought of it that way.

And how do I live life always holding my breath,

Like the superstitions tell you to do

Every moment, on edge,

Like the ledge that separates the living and the dying.

But I’ve never thought of it that way either.

I remember back to when

The neighbouring kids and I jumped that fence

We crossed the barrier to live through a different lens.

We found comfort in the silence,

In the shade cast by the graves.

We found peace

In the small crevices and niches of the trees.

We explored and ventured

Around mausoleums and quenched our thirst for adventure.

Now whenever I pass by

I look into it with increasingly longing eyes

Envious of the time kept within its confines

Because don’t the dead have all the time in the world but also none at all

Because with no way to use it they just let it fall

Away.

Freeze.

Somehow I find solace on the other side

A peace that the living can never abide by

Like on the other side is frozen time

And every time I climb that fence, I can freeze as well,

And I can wander over peaceful hill and yonder

Untouched by the tides of that time

That once unfrozen crash down

And sweep away the frozen ice

And they wake you up and make

You into one of the living.

And you grow up.

Because it’s ironic how on the living side,

Time is moving, flying by

But I can never decide what to do with it

That once I have it I can’t get enough of it,

Make it fit, the more I want of it

All the more it slips away

But when I never had it in the first place

Among the graves, there is no time for the dead

But yet they rest

Time is frozen but they get to keep it buried with them.

But maybe if the dead still had their time, they would let it slip away too,

And they would pray and pray to have it anew, for more

But they are only granted the amount they came onto this earth for.

They say time is money and I think that’s true

Because when we use it, it slips away

And when we don’t, it stays and weighs

Heavy on us like long Mondays

Or days spent doing nothing

But playing in the grass among the graves.

item.title: Dear Mother
item.description: Dear Mother. ​ Have you ever stopped to think On the consequences of your reactions, On the outcome of your actions, On exactly what you…
item.content:encoded:
Dear Mother.

​

Have you ever stopped to think

On the consequences of your reactions,

On the outcome of your actions,

On exactly what you want to teach the child you want to raise.

​

Do you want them to go out in the world and think for themselves,

To bring them out of their shells,

To be ready to take on the challenges,

The punches life throws.

Because there are a lot of those.

How do you want them to think, to speak

Do you want them confident or meek.

Do you want to build them up to survive

And thrive

Once you’re not around

Or do you think more about how they can support you now

Support you with words no child

Should ever hear out loud

Every time you criticize

You tell your lies

You don’t apologize

Be aware that your child is listening

Is taking it all in

Because what a child sees, he or she will do

Because actions speak louder than words,

It’s true.

Which has more of an impact, you think?

When you tell your child not to make the same mistakes you did

Or when you show them how to be

How to live and breathe how you believe

In accordance with what you truly know is alright.

That is a parent’s plight.

But it should be an easy answer, right?

Dear Mother

Do you ever question?

What you are teaching?

What kind of example you are preaching?

Do you want to encourage your children to stand tall

To solve their own problems,

To get through it all.

Or do you want them to forever have your voice in their head

Telling them they are better off dead

That they will never amount to anything with or without you.

No matter what they try or do.

That the only time they are doing good is when they obey every word you say

And don’t question.

Your intention.

Or your unjust suspension.

Your hypocrisy, your own deeds,

If they go against what you speak.

Do you really believe

Dear Mother

That you have nothing to do with their pain?

You, closest to them

And then

They are responsible for making you happy, for your happiness?

To expect them to pretend and lend

Themselves even when things aren’t okay, just to save

Your feelings?

But then you won’t do the same for them?

You expect them to be

The saviour to your negativity,

Pain, and past trauma.

And they are just supposed to come back and take it.

Because they are your child?

And they are ungrateful?

Selfish? Despicable?

That when you blame it all on the friends they choose

And every game that they lose

It’s because they didn’t listen to you

To the standards you hold them to

Even when you don’t do

Those things yourself.

Do you want to breed fear and pain from your position above.

Is that really what you want?

To choose power over love?

Have you ever stopped to think

That maybe your child is a separate entity from you

That they have their own mind

That maybe they know themselves better

That just because you are their mother

It doesn’t give you the excuse to silence them.

That because they are the child and you the parent

That doesn’t mean you always know better,

That whatever

They say

That you don’t agree with, they may not be wrong,

Insane?

That it doesn’t give you a free ticket to hate,

To berate

To humiliate

To sedate their feelings, to numb them out of existence.

Just because you don’t like that they sometimes have negative feelings.

It doesn’t give you the excuse

To verbally abuse.

Dear Mother

Do you ever stop to think if it’s right to respond to sadness with anger

To teach a child that when they don’t do exactly what you say they are unloved and a failure

That everything they do

Is only ever a product of you

When they do well?

Don’t you want your child to succeed with or without you

Or do you want them to doubt everything they do.

But when you choose

To raise them to hate

How can you expect them to love?

You say you give them everything

Materially, physically.

But everything you buy and provide

Means nothing when you are divided

Dear Mother.

item.title: Picture Windows
item.description: The spotless glass windows of the houses that you looked in Crossing streets when you were children Hold more truth than you could ever know…
item.content:encoded:
The spotless glass windows of the houses that you looked in

Crossing streets when you were children

Hold more truth than you could ever know.

From the outside looking in

Hoping you could catch a glimpse

Into something you know they’d never show.

Because maybe if the light illuminated it perfectly

Where you could see into every nook and cranny

Every crevice and corner, maybe

You’d find what they try to hide.

And maybe you were always looking for it

Just a tiny hint of something askew, bills left to accrue

Clothes tossed in a corner, carpet stained and left

Plants withered, petals peeling back

An overgrown garden, An overflowing garbage sack

Spills caught by countertops and table surfaces

Gardens left overgrown, fruit left to rot

Bathtub left to rust, shelves to gather dust

Leaves and dirt stomped in from shoes whose

Laces got untied and left loose.

And you wonder how much chaos a person has in their head

To need an environment so perfect, so well-kept

To distract them,

Because how much more order can they get

Those who cannot let a single thing be out of place

In their space.

How much cleaning do they have to do

To craft such a perfect picture window view

And when they finish that then what then?

Sit back and admire the perfection

Then do it all over again

And again

And

Again.

And then you wonder

Is the person who looks out from that window the same person who wipes that window down?

Are those the same hands who control what’s around?

Or are they different hands, stiffened hands?

Does one not have the time to spare

While the other wipes till their palm’s skin is laid bare?

With care, to create an environment that they dare

Show to a stranger’s stare

Looking

In

There?

With curtains drawn, the drapes up

Playing up the highlight reel.

But what’s behind those golden walls

What lurks in the shadows

In the places where the window has no view to?

​

You never know what’s going on in the house next door

Though they may have lived there thirty years or more

You may not always know what it is they live for.

You may look in through the skylights to check

Or their back patio or deck

And you may never know the extent of their woe

So you let it go

And you walk home back to your own

Form of outer perfection

Back behind your own

Picture perfect window.

item.title: Heaven's Gates
item.description: When I think of heaven Sometimes I think, when my time comes Would I get in? When I knock on the door, when I approach the gates Will I be…
item.content:encoded:
When I think of heaven

Sometimes I think, when my time comes

Would I get in?

When I knock on the door, when I approach the gates

Will I be let in?

When would that setting set in

Because when I am around good I feel undeserving,

Mislead in a sense, regretting

What I am getting into, betting

That when I enter a room, introduce myself,

I’m just a shell in a sense, messing

Around, just pretending

To be good instead of letting

Who I really am come through,

Temporarily subletting

My mind to good thoughts and a happy view.

Uncomfortable.

Even on earth, where nothing is perfect

I feel allergic, always on the verge, sick

I feel at home with shame

Like my best friends are guilt and pain

And how I feel when it rains

Like the sun is just temporary

And it makes me wary.

But when people read my obituary

What will they see?

Will they remember the person I used to be?

What will they read?

What will they actually agree with?

Are these poems that come out of me

The only time people actually know who I am and will ever be

The only indication of something deeper

Below the surface, that I dare not surface

Any other time

That this other side like a pantomime

Mimicking the sublime

Mirroring the summertime.

But when the ultimate judge rates the score

How does he decide who could have done more?

How does he separate the ones who tried enough?

How can he define what is love?

From his reign above

He can look down and see below

But how does he know?

How does he know what’s inside?

How much people try to hide or lie

And once they die

What rules they should actually have abided by?

Who can actually tell us this?

Because the only thing I’ve heard in words

Have only ever been from other humans.

What if even true judges can only be comparative?

That the judging is based on “who does better than this?”

Like the sacrificial poet in the judging round

There are people who get to stay in the middle ground

I guess that’s what they call purgatory.

But do these souls get neither or both of sin and glory?

What if people are chosen at random to be in the middle

And they straddle each edge just a little

Without ever getting remittal or acquittal

For their sins or their judgement, noncommittal

Just shy of either side, without ever crossing either line

And fine

What if it’s all subjective?

Sometimes I think I’m at the end of my road,

That all the things I used to have are gone and my soul sold.

The other day a dog growled at me,

He was scared.

How much of a terrible person must I be

For a dog not to think it fair, to dare approach,

To care enough to share the stairs, on my way up

The stare from those pair of eyes

Burned into me, the memory, snared

Captured in my brain, wearing the pain

Of it on my sleeve.

Because dogs are intuitive, they know and they understand,

So where does that leave me, where does my soul stand?

But when I look deep inside of me, can I find the person I used to be?

And this highlight reel that I steal

Put together out of bits and pieces and fragments of what was shown to me

And how I was taught to deal with how I feel

With how I learned to steer the wheel

Is any of part of it real?

Or is it simply there to conceal,

Built up to never reveal what’s underneath?

And can it be peeled back, or is it sealed?

That I will always question with contention

Introspection, but with good intention,

I think.

I proceed with intervention of the mind

To find the real me,

But I find I’ve been my own enemy,

I fight my own body

And leave my soul behind.

I lie to myself about what’s best

And hide from the light, out from plain sight

For fear I might climb the height

Only to mess up my flight.

Can we escape our fate when we stand at the gate?

I know I shouldn’t lose hope and that we should fight,

But is heaven a place we can actually find

After we leave the life we’ve left behind?

item.title: Mosquito
item.description: Last night I found a mosquito in my bed It fed On my inhibition My indecision. I kept trying to kill it though, It’s buzzing so loud and…
item.content:encoded:
Last night I found a mosquito in my bed

It fed

On my inhibition

My indecision.

I kept trying to kill it though,

It’s buzzing so loud and low

I couldn’t hear myself think, I couldn’t lay

In bed and sink

Into oblivion

Find comfort in the sheets

The quietness that I seek

It just kept buzzing around

That sound

I couldn’t rest my head

Until it was out or dead

I couldn’t retreat into space

It’s buzzing so invasive.

Then when it finally came into view

I threw

All my strength

Into cutting it at length

But it came back

It always comes back.

It always.

Comes back.

And before I can react

It’s on me once again

Inserting it’s stinger like a deadly pen

Etching into me it’s mark

Forever carved

With the symbol

Of its simple

Desire to feed

To heed the need

To lead by greed

Hunger and lust for implanting it’s seed

A parasite by design

Never drawing the line

Never seeing the sign

It leaves behind

The little bump, little bruise

It’s choosing

To risk its own life to lose

For the sake of its children back home

What it considers a home

Is it evil?

By design.

Is a parasite evil?

item.title: Wicked Games
The Last Fight
Systems: A Stop-Motion Film
item.description: Systems is a stop-motion film I created one rainy afternoon when I felt inspired and moved by one of Muse’s epic instrumentals. The stop…
item.content:encoded:
Systems is a stop-motion film I created one rainy afternoon when I felt inspired and moved by one of Muse’s epic instrumentals.

The stop-motion video Systems was inspired by one of my favourite songs and cinematographically acclaimed music videos: The 2nd Law: Isolated System.

You can view the official music video for Muse’s song here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VXPoJAyeF8k

I was sitting at my desk doodling on graph paper to the thirteenth track on Muse’s sixth Studio album of the same name (The 2nd Law), when I decided to ask myself what if colour-coded systems could be isolated and pulled apart through forces that were entirely their own?

The video that manifested from this concept can be viewed below on my channel:

In the video, the isolated “systems” are in constant motion, continuously attempting to outrun the other. They not only fail to do so but also trap themselves in the process.

And in an isolated system, “entropy can only increase”…

The tools used to create this stop-motion film were:

  • fine liner
  • coloured pencils
  • graph paper
  • tape

item.title: Systems: A Stop-Motion Film
item.description: UofT Toastmasters (UTT) Website Content The following showcases the work I have done co-authoring and editing content for the UofT…
item.content:encoded:
UofT Toastmasters (UTT) Website Content

The following showcases the work I have done co-authoring and editing content for the UofT Toastmasters website.

As the Executive Editor for the University of Toronto Toastmasters (UTT) Club, I have quite a few responsibilites. Among being in charge of co-writing and editing weekly emails about the theme and topic of each club meeting, sending out meeting and club updates, and putting together meeting minutes for the club’s bimonthly executive meetings, I have also worked on co-writing and editing the club’s webite content.

Below you will find a screenshot of the site’s main webpage:

“Toastmasters International (TI) is a US headquartered nonprofit educational organization that operates clubs worldwide for the purpose of helping members improve their communication, public speaking, and leadership skills.”

UTT is an official branch of Toastmasters International, created as a club at UofT to help students practice their public speaking and verbal communication skills in a supportive peer group environment.

Students take on various team roles and responsibilities on a weekly basis. They are given opportunities to contribute by both giving and receiving feedback and by giving speeches to other club members. The goal of the club is to help members sharpen their oral communication, leadership, and team communication skills.

You can find more information about our club on our website, linked below.

item.content:encoded:
During my time at IBM, I worked on some of the products which the company was moving to the cloud. I took on the role of author for the IBM Bluemix Blog in order to post blog updates for the products.

You can view the post I authored for IBM Informix on Cloud for Bluemix by clicking the link below: https://www.ibm.com/blogs/bluemix/2016/10/ibm-informix-cloud-bluemix/

item.content:encoded:
list

  • poetry
  • technical writing
  • business writing
  • short film
  • musical performance

blog articles short stories speeches

-creative writing (short stories/stories/novels; add all links to purchase stories here also when they become published!!) -poetry (poems; add links to published collection of poems here) -music (videos/recordings/link to YouTube) -technical writing (Bluemix Blog, etc.) -business writing (web content writing projects) -blog posts and articles (all speeches converted into blog posts/articles/reviews with affiliate links which are published on Medium)
